quote: If Christ were here there is one thing he would not be—a Christian.
author: Mark Twain,  Notebook

quote: To be a Christian means to forgive the inexcusable because God has forgiven the inexcusable in you.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: It is not possible to be 'incidentally a Christian.' The fact of Christianity must be overwhelmingly first or nothing. This suggests a reason for the dislike of Christians by nominal or non-Christians: their lives contain no overwhelming first but many balances.
author: Sheldon Vanauken

quote: I am a religious person, although I am not a believer.
author: Philip Pullman

quote: I call him religious who understands the suffering of others.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: God, who am I?
author: Sylvia Plath,  The Unabridged Journals of Sylvia Plath

quote: To be a Christian is to live dangerously, honestly, freely - to step in the name of love as if you may land on nothing, yet to keep on stepping because the something that sustains you no empire can give you and no empire can take away.
author: Cornel West

quote: Religion, n. A daughter of Hope and Fear, explaining to Ignorance the nature of the Unknowable.
author: Ambrose Bierce,  The Unabridged Devil's Dictionary

quote: Growing up going to Christian school and the concept that you're born a sinner and you don't really have a choice to change who you are has been hammered into my head and created the entire reason why I made art and made a band and made records called 'Antichrist Superstar.'
author: Marilyn Manson

quote: I believe in Christianity as I believe that the sun has risen: not only because I see it, but because by it I see everything else.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: Of course we're Christian. The very name of the church declares that. The more people see us and come to know us, the more I believe they will come to realize that we are trying to exemplify in our lives and in our living the great ideals which (Jesus Christ) taught.
author: Gordon B. Hinckley

quote: Christian faith is... basically about love and being loved and reconciliation. These things are so important, they're foundational and they can transform individuals, families.
author: Philip Yancey

quote: Christianity is not about how much faith you have. Its about Who your faith is in.
author: Mike Donahey

quote: I've been a Christian since I was a little girl. But my Christianity is a muddy mess of thoughts and opinions and making God into what works for me-like going shopping at the mall and picking out whatever I want, putting together faith like I would an outfit. Somehow I don't think the Creator, the I AM, the savior of the world is something we can mix and match to out liking.
author: Cindy Martinusen Coloma,  Caleb + Kate

quote: If you are a Christian, you are not a citizen of this world trying to get to heaven; you are a citizen of heaven making your way through this world.
author: Vance Havner

quote: A Christian goes to college to discover his vocation - and to develop skills necessary to occupy a section of cultural, intellectual domain in a manner worthy of the kingdom of God.A believer also goes to college to gain general information and habits of thought necessary for developing a well-structured soul suitable for a well-informed, good citizen of both earthly and heavenly kingdoms.
author: JP Morelands

quote: Whoever has My commandments and keeps them loves Me. And he who loves Me will be loved by My Father, and I will love him and show Myself to him.
author: Anonymous

quote: A faith to live by, a self to live with, and a purpose to live for.
author: Bob Harrington

quote: Only a very few can be learned, but all can be Christian, all can be devout, and – I shall boldly add – all can be theologians.
author: Desiderius Erasmus

quote: My true religion, my faith in God. He gives me love and compassion. I simply return them by loving and being compassionate towards others. Our own heart, our own mind, is the temple of God. The teachings of God is to love one another as he loves us. We love by respecting and being compassionate, whatever they decide to do with their life
author: Ann Marie Aguilar

quote: Religion. A daughter of Hope and Fear, explaining to Ignorance the nature of the Unknowable.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: The fact that my continuous and public rejection of Christianity does not worry me in the least should suggest to you just how inadequate I think your reasons for being a Christian are.
author: Sam Harris,  Letter to a Christian Nation

quote: I need Christ, not something that resembles Him.
author: C.S. Lewis,  A Grief Observed

quote: If my name were C. Ross, I’d definitely be religious.
author: Jarod Kintz,  A Story That Talks about Talking Is Like Chatter to Chattering Teeth, and Every Set of Dentures Can Attest to the Fact That No..

quote: Going to church doesn’t make you a Christian any more than going to a garage makes you an automobile.
author: Billy Sunday,  Billy Sunday, the Man and His Message: With His Own Words Which Have Won Thousands for Christ

quote: The primary source of the appeal of Christianity was Jesus - His incarnation, His life, His crucifixion, and His resurrection.
author: Kenneth Scott Latourette

quote: The older I grow and the more I abandon myself to God's will, the lessI value intelligence that wants to know and will that wants to do; andas the only element of salvation I recognize faith, which can wait patiently,without asking too many questions.
author: Umberto Eco,  The Name of the Rose

quote: You didn’t just automatically become a Christian, did you? You weren’t made a Christian by just going to church. Just like you are not made a car by sitting in a garage all day! You have to make a decision.
author: Corallie Buchanan,  Watch Out! Godly Women on the Loose

quote: Have faith in your beliefs
author: Michael Christos Zeis

quote: Christians walk as strangers in the world: They are untamed. They are free. To persevere with love, yet untamed by man, is often what leaves that open space for divine revelation when God so wills.
author: Criss Jami,  Killosophy

quote: Religion. It's given people hope in a world torn apart by religion.
author: Jon Stewart

quote: We are called to service in the kingdom of God. The Christian life is not about what you claim. It is about what you believe. True belief cannot be separated from what we do.
author: Tyler Edwards,  Zombie Church: Breathing Life Back Into the Body of Christ

quote: In God's eyes, a man who teaches one truth and nothing else is more righteous than a man who teaches a million truths and one lie.
author: Criss Jami,  Killosophy

quote: I am philosophical Christ; crucified on the cross of ignorance for the sake ofdivine vanity.
author: Kedar Joshi

quote: I don't think it's possible to c-call yourself a C-Christian and... and j-just leave out the awkward bits.' -Wilfred Owen
author: Pat Barker,  Regeneration

quote: I can only say that I am nothing but a poor sinner, trusting in Christ alone for salvation.
author: Robert E. Lee

quote: The aim of all Christian education, moreover, is to train the believer in an adult faith that can make him a "new creation", capable of bearing witness in his surroundings to the Christian hope that inspires him.
author: Pope Benedict XVI,  The Sacrament Of Charity: Sacramentum Caritatis

quote: What we want is not more little books about Christianity, but more little books by Christians on other subjects--with their Christianity latent.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: I have a great mind to believe in Christianity for the mere pleasure of fancying I may be damned.
author: George Gordon Byron

quote: Every Christian should be both conservative and radical; conservative in preserving the faith and radical in applying it.
author: John R.W. Stott

quote: Love and respect all people. Hate and destroy all faith.
author: Penn Jillette,  God, No!: Signs You May Already Be an Atheist and Other Magical Tales

quote: Love is my religion, kindness is my prayer, forgiveness is my temple, and peace is my abode.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: For he who loves God without faith reflects on himself, while the person who loves God in faith reflects on God.
author: Søren Kierkegaard,  Fear and Trembling

quote: A soft and sheltered Christianity, afraid to be lean and lone, unwilling to face the storms and brave the heights, will end up fat and foul in the cages of conformity.
author: Vance Havner

quote: I'm a Christian first, and a mean-spirited, bigoted conservative second, and don't you ever forget it. You know who else was kind of "divisive"in terms of challenging the status quo and the powers-that-be of his day? Jesus Christ.
author: Ann Coulter,  If Democrats Had Any Brains, They'd Be Republicans

quote: Christians are hard to tolerate; I don’t know how Jesus does it
author: Bono

quote: I'm Catholic. I don't pray, I just ask for forgiveness after.
author: Abigail Roux,  Crash & Burn

quote: Atheism, a religion dedicated to its own sense of smug superiority.
author: Stephen Colbert

quote: The Christian religion asks us to put our trust not in ideas, and certainly not in ideologies, but in a God Who was vulnerable enough to become human and die, and Who desires to be present to us in our ordinary circumstances.
author: Kathleen Norris

quote: Far better it is for you to say: "I am a sinner,"than to say: "I have no need of religion."The empty can be filled, but the self-intoxicated have no room for God.
author: Fulton J. Sheen,  Seven Words of Jesus and Mary: Lessons from Cana and Calvary
